alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 17 at 12:29PM PST until January 19 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM WEDNESDAY TO 4 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations below 4500 feet of 4 to 10 inches. Total snow accumulations above 4500 feet of 10 to 20 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada including Interstate 80 over Donner Pass, Highway 50 over Echo Summit and Highway 88 over Carson Pass. * WHEN...From 4 PM Wednesday to 4 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels 3500 to 4000 feet decreasing to 2500 to 3000 feet early Thursday morning. Light accumulations are possible down to 2000 feet Thursday morning with lingering snow showers and lower snow levels.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
